segments.text: The whole scene feels like a snapshot of childhood mischief.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I see the boy’s fingers just brushing the edge of the cookie jar; it’s almost poetic.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Yet, I can’t shake off the worry that he’s going to fall and hurt himself.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The woman remains oblivious; her focus is on drying that plate like it’s the most important job in the world.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wish I could just shout to her, to warn her of the impending chaos brewing behind her.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: But maybe that's the beauty of it; the innocence of childhood clashes with adult responsibilities.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I just hope nothing goes wrong before someone finally notices.
segments.speaker: PAR
